name: Denitrification Potential (floodplain wetness)
functionStatement: Nitrogen and phosphorus transformations feed primary production, regulate excess loads, and store or release nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Adequate floodplain/wetland pockets for denitrification, consistent with local reference.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Assess presence of wet pockets and redox indicators. Use hydric soils and wetlands mapping as a screening proxy.

inputs.label: Denitrification Potential (floodplain wetness)
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Strong potential with connected wet areas and soils. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some wet zones but partially disconnected. / Limited wetland area and moderate export risk. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: No wetlands or heavily drained soils with low denitrification potential. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)
